sources.note: Main homepage — identifies EndoSoft as endoscopy EHR company, lists 4 products (EndoVault, Qlinical, Argus AI, Approvon), 10 specialties, and migration capabilities

Qlinical product page on endosoft.com — lists features (consultation, imaging, procedure docs, ENR, scheduling, e-prescriptions), positions as cloud-based for small/medium practices with subscription pricing
Company history — founded 1995 by Rakesh and Manish Madan, started with endoscopic image capture, grew into full EHR company

EndoVault flagship product page — full EHR with patient portal, CPOE, PACS, DICOM, ENR, scheduling, inventory, time & material billing. Useful for understanding what the full platform does vs Qlinical
Certifications page — ISO 13485:2016, ISO 27001, HIMSS membership, UK NEDi2 compliance, GIQuIC integration, Cyber Essentials Plus, DHA/VA approvals, IHE Connectathon participation 2013-2019
Global office locations — HQ in Schenectady NY, plus offices in UK, Netherlands, India, Australia, China, Germany, UAE, Canada
EndoVault features detail page — discusses customization, GRS reporting tool, HL7 interface notifications, downtime mode, ENR details, integrations, Argus AI integration
Approvon product — procedure order approval workflow, developed with NHS Gateshead, includes pre-assessment for nursing/admin staff
Qlinical standalone product site — cloud-based application with consultation, imaging, procedure documentation, invoicing modules. Includes ONC certification disclosure statement
Consultation features — image management, progress notes, history evaluation, patient consent, invoicing, referral letters, discharge summary
Imaging features — HD image/video capture, one-click capture, diagram annotation, procedure reports
Procedure documentation features — report generation (PDF), quality of care indicators, image management, picklists, direct email
Invoicing page — appears broken/misloaded, shows imaging/procedure content instead of invoicing details
EHI export documentation — lists 23 exportable data sections, supports C-CDA XML and FHIR bulk export (ndjson). Single/multi patient and bulk export methods
Argus AI product site — NLP voice-activated procedure report writer, automated quality metrics, MedGPT generative chart review. Vendor-neutral, integrates with existing EHRs
GI specialty page — redirected to main homepage, same content as homepage
